segments.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā … pe … ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha … and asked him,

segments.pli: So na sukaro saṅkhātuṃ ettakāni vassāni iti vā … pe … ettakāni vassasatasahassāni iti vā”ti.
segments.en: It’s not easy to calculate how many years, how many hundreds or thousands or hundreds of thousands of years it lasts.”
“But sir, is it possible to give a simile?”

segments.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhu, āyasaṃ nagaraṃ yojanaṃ āyāmena yojanaṃ vitthārena yojanaṃ ubbedhena, puṇṇaṃ sāsapānaṃ guḷikābaddhaṃ.
segments.en: “Suppose there was an iron city, a league long, a league wide, and a league high, full of mustard seeds pressed into balls.

segments.pli: Tato puriso vassasatassa vassasatassa accayena ekamekaṃ sāsapaṃ uddhareyya.
segments.en: And as each century passed someone would remove a single mustard seed.

segments.pli: Khippataraṃ kho so, bhikkhu, mahāsāsaparāsi iminā upakkamena parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gaccheyya, na tveva kappo.
segments.en: By this means the huge heap of mustard seeds would be used up before the eon comes to an end.
That’s how long an eon is.

segments.pli: Evaṃ dīghānaṃ kho, bhikkhu, kappānaṃ neko kappo saṃsito, nekaṃ kappasataṃ saṃsitaṃ, nekaṃ kappasahassaṃ saṃsitaṃ, nekaṃ kappasatasahassaṃ saṃsitaṃ.
segments.en: And we’ve transmigrated through many such eons, many hundreds, many thousands, many hundreds of thousands.
This is quite enough for you to become disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed regarding all conditions.”

suttaplex.blurb: A city filled with mustard seeds might be emptied before the end of an eon.
